articles.description: The final act of the Blue Ghost lander's busy two weeks on the moon was to send back sunset shots featuring Earth and Venus.
articles.content:
What it is: Sunset on the moon, part of the first collection
 of high-definition imagery of a lunar sunset
Where it is: Mons Latreille, a mountain in the moon's Mare Crisium ("Sea of Crises") basin… [+2669 chars]

articles.title: Researcher Finally Solve Math Question Left Unanswered for Over 40 Years - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Researchers have solved a long-standing problem in topology by helping classify four-dimensional shapes (4-manifolds) that allow certain types of deformations, known as quasiregular mappings, from Euclidean space. Susanna Heikkilä has made a significant break…
articles.content: In their work, mathematicians focus on thinking. Susanna Heikkilä’s preferred way of working is to hatch ideas with pen and paper. When working with others, a blackboard is a must. Credit: Riitta-Lee… [+8235 chars]

articles.title: World’s oldest fish was presumed extinct for 60 million years before being rediscovered - Earth.com
articles.description: Researchers classify the coelacanth under the group Sarcopterygii, which include the earliest ancestors of amphibians, reptiles, and mammals.
articles.content:
Among the many wonders and ancient tales about marine life and ocean creatures, one fish long believed to have vanished from our planet captured worldwide attention.

articles.title: Curiosity rover cracked open a rock and may have settled the 'life on Mars' debate - Earth.com
articles.description: Curiosity rover cracked open a Martian rock, revealing a sight never before seen on Mars - a dazzling display of yellow sulfur crystals.
articles.content: Imagine taking a leisurely Sunday drive, and you accidentally smash something on the road that turns out to be an unprecedented scientific revelation. Well, that’s exactly what happened to NASA’s Cur… [+5772 chars]

articles.title: Speed of quantum entanglement is measured, but it's too fast for humans to understand - Earth.com
articles.description: Even when particles seem to shift in the blink of an eye, as with quantum entanglement, there are measurable intervals involved.
